evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Article III of the Treaty excludes Indigenous people from paying duty on goods carried across the border ... The Jay Treaty established a border between the continental United States and Great Britain that artificially separated Native American peoples ... Plaintiffs are enrolled members of the approximately 17,500 member Blackfeet Nation ... Plaintiffs conduct business and travel across the U.S. – Canada border ... Plaintiffs challenge the constitutionality of Executive Order 14193 as amended ...

extracted.value: Historical trade rights under Jay Treaty (1794) and Treaty of Ghent (1814) granting Indigenous people duty-free border passage; border history bisecting tribal homelands; tariffs imposed under Executive Orders 14193, 14197, 14231, and Proclamations 10896/10895 impacting tribal commerce at Montana ports of entry
